WorkItem.Description:
There's a problem when using multi select in Virtualization mode since the ItemContainerGenerator will in that case return a null value and the control crashes.

I've also remarked that there's too much overhead in the current multiselect implementation. I tried using it for selecting geometry data of complex 3D models and it takes ages to select more than 10 000 items.

The DataGrid in .NET 4.0 has a really nice multiselect function and it works like a charm even with 100 000 objects. We should have a look into it!

Really like your work,

/Mikael

Regards
Ok, I found the problem. The selection with shift does not work, because elements are selected which are not visible. Doing that will result in a quite long time for selection. I see...

This is a major bug. And, at the moment I dont have an idea how to fix it. 

The problem is, that in WPF the children of a treenode are calculated by the UI (HierarchicalDatatemplate/HeaderedItemsControl). So if the node is not visible and the virtualization is on, the UI is not initialized and there is not way to find/select the children. 

As a workaround, I will prevent selection with shift if virtualization is enabled. Then at least no exception is thrown anymore.

If anyone has a better idea, please let me know.
